critique: The document reflects President Roosevelt's approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Retail Solid Fuel Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. This act was a key component of the New Deal, aimed at regulating industries to promote economic recovery during the Great Depression. The document emphasizes federal authority and intervention in the economy, with the President retaining the power to modify the code based on its effects. There is no discussion of immigration, civil liberties, or social issues.
